# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    words = split(text)

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            wrapped_text += word
        else
            wrapped_text *= " "
            wrapped_text += word
        end
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped. Keep in mind the text_width parameter."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, I've defined a `wrap_string` function that takes a string and a maximum text width as input. The function wraps words to fit the specified width, adding a newline when necessary.

The example usage demonstrates how you can use this function with a given text and text_width.
